item.title: Charles add a quote by Bertolt Brecht
item.description: "In the dark times Will there also be singing? Yes, there will also be singing. About the dark times." -- Bertolt Brecht

item.title: Charles add a quote by Max Ernst
item.description: "When the artist finds himself he is lost. The fact that he has succeeded in never finding himself is regarded by Max Ernst as his only lasting achievement. " -- Max Ernst

item.title: Charles add a quote by Niccolò Machiavelli
item.description: "With regard to prudence and stability, I say a people is more prudent, more stable and more just than a prince." -- Niccolò Machiavelli

item.title: Charles add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "It is not a lack of love, but a lack of friendship that makes unhappy marriages." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Charles add a quote by Italo Calvino
item.description: "The things that the novel does not say are necessarily more numerous than those it does say and only a special halo around what is written can give the illusion that you are reading also what is not written." -- Italo Calvino

item.title: Charles add a quote by Colette
item.description:
"Put down everything that comes into your head and then you're a writer. But an author is one who can judge his own stuff's worth, without pity, and destroy most of it."
(<i>Casual Chance</i>, 1964)" -- Colette

item.title: Charles add a quote by Frank O'Hara
item.description: "After the first glass of vodka you can accept just about anything of life even your own mysteriousness you think it is nice that a box of matches is purple and brown and is called La Petite and comes from Sweden for they are words that you know and that is all you know words not their feelings or what they mean and you write because you know them not because you understand them because you don't you are stupid and lazy and will never be great but you do what you know because what else is there?" -- Frank O'Hara

item.title: Charles add a quote by Franz Kafka
item.description: "A book must be the axe for the frozen sea within us." -- Franz Kafka

item.title: Charles add a quote by Plato
item.description: "The price good men pay for indifference to public affairs is to be ruled by evil men." -- Plato

item.title: Charles add a quote by Tom Wolfe
item.description: "A cult is a religion with no political power." -- Tom Wolfe

item.title: Charles add a quote by Robert Anton Wilson
item.description: "belief is the death of intelligence." -- Robert Anton Wilson

item.title: Charles add a quote by Kenneth Koch
item.description: "I don't know where you'd find such a magazine." ~ on the stipulations set by a benefactor to the Harvard Advocate that the staff contain no Jews, homosexuals, or drunks" -- Kenneth Koch

item.title: Charles add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Everything in the world is about sex except sex. Sex is about power." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Charles add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Why should we take advice on sex from the pope? If he knows anything about it, he shouldn't!" -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Charles add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "It is therefore senseless to think of complaining since nothing foreign has decided what we feel, what we live, or what we are." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Charles add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Charles add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "I am my world." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Charles add a quote by Heraclitus
item.description: "Even a soul submerged in sleep is hard at work and helps make something of the world." -- Heraclitus

item.title: Charles add a quote by David Hume
item.description: "Generally speaking, the errors in religion are dangerous; those in philosophy only ridiculous." -- David Hume

item.title: Charles add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "The truth does not change according to our ability to stomach it." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Charles add a quote by Alfred Korzybski
item.description: "The map is not the territory." -- Alfred Korzybski

item.title: Charles add a quote by George Orwell
item.description: "The essence of being human is that one does not seek perfection." -- George Orwell

item.title: Charles add a quote by Napoleon Bonaparte
item.description: "In politics, stupidity is not a handicap." -- Napoleon Bonaparte

item.title: Charles add a quote by Solon
item.description: "No more good must be attempted than the nation can bear" -- Solon

item.title: Charles add a quote by Pericles
item.description: "Just because you do not take an interest in politics doesn't mean politics won't take an interest in you. " -- Pericles

item.title: Charles add a quote by Thomas Jefferson
item.description: "I would rather be exposed to the inconveniences attending too much liberty than to those attending too small a degree of it." -- Thomas Jefferson

item.title: Charles add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "The man who does not read has no advantage over the man who cannot read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Charles add a quote by John Ruskin
item.description: "A man wrapped up in himself makes a very small parcel." -- John Ruskin

item.title: Charles add a quote by Ludwig Wittgenstein
item.description: "Not how the world is, but that it is, is the mystery." -- Ludwig Wittgenstein

item.title: Charles add a quote by John Waters
item.description: "If you go home with somebody, and they don't have books, don't fuck 'em!" -- John Waters
